pullRequest.body:
This matches `Matrix.det_units_conj` and friends.

This doesn't actually help for the case of invertible matrices indexed by different indices, but is handy for square ones.


---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11229896369/job/31216249583)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11229896369/job/31216249407)
Does it make sense to state this in terms of [IsConj](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Conj.html#IsConj) instead?
I didn't even know we had `IsConj`!

My preference would be to postpone that to a later refactor; writing `conj` lemmas the way I do in this PR is reasonably established, and `IsConj` is probably only beneficial if we apply it everywhere.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Matrix.trace_units_conj`
